5:

8:

>>> connect battery anode to green light bulb anode <<<
9:
Okay, I have connected the battery anode to the green light bulb anode. Now I need to connect the remaining terminals to the unknown substance B to test its conductivity. I will use the black wire from my inventory.

First I need to connect the black wire to the green light bulb.

10:

11:

12:

13:

14:

>>> connect blue wire terminal 2 to battery cathode <<<
15:
The circuit should now be complete. If the unknown substance B is conductive, the green light bulb should light up. If it is non-conductive, it will not. I will activate the battery to see if the light bulb lights up.

16:
I apologize, I mistakenly tried to activate the battery. I need to observe the light bulb to see if it lights up. The previous action "connect blue wire terminal 2 to battery cathode" completed the circuit. Therefore, if the substance is conductive, the light bulb should already be lit.

I will observe the green light bulb to determine if it is lit.

>>> look at green light bulb <<<
17:
The green light bulb is off. This indicates that the unknown substance B is NOT electrically conductive.
